item.title: @TonyZador @Mark_Solms @pennybun01 @GaryMarcus @WiringTheBrain @anne_churchland @Nancy_Kanwisher @neurograce no question that finely layered cortex of mammals is beautiful innovation. I just don't like to discount enormous complexity/"power" of vertebrate brains. Doing that we realize that there's so much to understand about the differences. I'm strongly non corticocentric in that sense

item.title: This project started as a conversation between @abigails_greene , @coreyhorien, and I about â€œbrain state.â€ We each use this term in descriptions of our research ranging from whole-brain fMRI in patient populations (Abby, Corey) to cell- and circuit-level recordings in mice (me).

item.content:encoded: This project started as a conversation between @abigails_greene , @coreyhorien, and I about â€œbrain state.â€ We each use this term in descriptions of our research ranging from whole-brain fMRI in patient populations (Abby, Corey) to cell- and circuit-level recordings in mice (me).

item.title: We wondered if there was anything in common between what each of us was referring to as a â€œbrain state.â€ And does it actually matter?
